strings.ui.cv.title: What to include in your CV
strings.ui.cv.tip: Keep it simple: 1-page CV, no photo is fine in Australia.
strings.ui.contracts.pt_b3: Need to give notice to leave
strings.tab.certificates.title: Certificates
strings.cert.usual.title: The usual ones
strings.cert.rsa.label: RSA
strings.cert.white.label: White Card
strings.cert.usi.label: USI
strings.cert.heads.title: Heads up!
strings.cert.heads.text: Some certificates vary by state. Check if it‚Äôs valid where you‚Äôll work.
strings.cert.strategy.title: Strategy
strings.cert.strategy.text: No need to do them all on day one: get the ones that unlock quick jobs in your state.
strings.visa.section.title: Visa & requirements
strings.visa.overview.title: Visa & requirements
strings.visa.overview.card_note: Always check the official website: requirements change.
strings.visa.requirements.which_title: Which visa do I have? (417 or 462)
strings.visa.requirements.which_2: Age: usually 18‚Äì30 (up to 35 for some countries).
strings.visa.requirements.processing_text_1: Average approval time: 1 day to 4 weeks.
strings.visa.requirements.processing_text_2: Timing varies by country and season. Apply 2‚Äì3 months before travel.
strings.visa.requirements.title: Visa requirements
strings.visa.documents.title: Documents to upload
strings.visa.documents.item_2: Bank statement or proof of funds
strings.visa.requirements.callout_text: Requirements change. Always verify on the official website.
strings.visa.apply.step_5: Check email and respond if they request more info
strings.visa.apply.entry_deadline_text: After approval you usually have 12 months to enter Australia for the first time.
strings.visa.apply.tip: Save documents to Drive + an offline copy on your phone.
strings.before.section.title: Before arrival
strings.before.section.description: Cards, hostel, CV, and prep to arrive smoothly.
strings.before.overview.title: Before arrival
strings.before.overview.summary: Prep, money, hostel and CV at a glance.
strings.before.overview.card_note: Before you arrive: choose city, plan money, book hostel, prep CVs.
strings.before.prep.tip: Pick the city based on your goal: quick job, cost, or vibe.
strings.before.lodging.hostel_3: Use the ads to find housing and work.
strings.before.lodging.tip: Ask for weekly discount or a stable shared room. Also, look for jobs on online boards while you stay there.
strings.before.money.card_4: Avoid fees: choose bank/app with good FX rates.
strings.before.cv.roles_1: Hospitality ‚Üí keep CV simple + show personality
strings.before.cv.tip_block: Bring printed copies and keep PDFs on your phone.
strings.arrival.section.title: Arrival & paperwork
strings.arrival.section.description: SIM, internet, TFN, certificates and first real steps.
strings.arrival.sim.title: SIM
strings.arrival.sim.summary: How to get data and not be stranded on day one.
strings.arrival.sim.typical_text: You arrive with no internet. Get a local SIM in town
strings.arrival.sim.before_text: Download offline Google Maps for the area and check how to get to your hostel.
strings.arrival.sim.chk_1: I downloaded the city offline map
strings.arrival.sim.chk_2: I have a plan to buy a SIM on day one
strings.arrival.tfn.title: TFN
strings.arrival.tfn.summary: How to apply and what happens if you don‚Äôt have it yet.
strings.arrival.tfn.what_text: TFN is your tax number to work and pay taxes.
strings.arrival.tfn.how_1: Go to the official ATO website
strings.arrival.tfn.how_3: Provide an address to receive it (can take up to 2 weeks)
strings.arrival.tfn.ato_text: Open the official ATO page to apply online.
strings.arrival.tfn.important_text: You can start working while the TFN is in process, but tell the employer.
strings.arrival.tfn.chk_2: I have a safe address to receive the TFN
strings.arrival.cert.chk_rsa: I decided if I need RSA now
strings.arrival.cert.chk_white: I decided if I need White Card now
strings.arrival.cert.chk_state: I checked the course is for my state
strings.housing.section.title: Housing
strings.housing.section.description: How to find a room, rent, bond and avoid scams.
strings.housing.shared.title: Sharing
strings.housing.shared.summary: Groups, marketplace and how to do inspections right.
strings.housing.shared.where_text: In many cities, Facebook is the hub to find housing (local groups + marketplace).
strings.housing.shared.process_2: Write on the post asking for an inspection and introduce yourself
strings.housing.shared.process_4: Agree on bond and move-in date
strings.housing.shared.good_text: Always ask what‚Äôs included (bills, internet, furniture).
strings.housing.shared.warning_text: No inspection = possible scam. Never pay before seeing the place.
strings.housing.shared.quick_text:
Hi! I‚Äôm arriving on (date). Looking for a shared or private room.
I‚Äôm clean, respectful and available immediately. Thanks!
strings.housing.shared.chk_1: I joined my city's Facebook housing groups
strings.housing.shared.chk_3: I didn't pay anything before seeing the place
strings.housing.lease.title: Lease
strings.housing.lease.summary: When it‚Äôs worth it and what a lease transfer is.
strings.housing.lease.when_text: If you‚Äôll stay 6‚Äì12 months in the same place, renting via real state agency can be cheaper and better.
strings.housing.lease.key_3: Lease transfer: change tenant if you leave early (per conditions)
strings.housing.lease.chk_1: I checked agency options (Real Estate, etc.)
strings.work.section.title: Job
strings.work.section.description: Apply more to have more options
strings.work.online.title: Online
strings.work.online.summary: Top 3 channels: Facebook groups, local job sites, and the app map to email CVs.
strings.work.online.fb.title: Facebook groups
strings.work.online.fb.search_1: Join city/state Facebook groups + ‚Äújobs / work / backpacker‚Äù.
strings.work.online.fb.search_2: Check posts and send a message / CV.
strings.work.online.fb.callout_text: Hi! I‚Äôm arriving on (date). Experience in hospitality/cleaning. Available immediately. I send you my CV. Thanks!
strings.work.online.webs.title: Job sites
strings.work.online.map.title: App map
strings.work.online.map.quick_1: Find the contact on the map.
strings.work.online.map.callout_text: Hi, I‚Äôm (Name). I‚Äôm available from (date) and I have experience in (‚Ä¶). CV attached. Thank you!
strings.work.face.title: Face to face
strings.work.face.summary: How to hand out CVs and talk to the manager.
strings.work.face.routine_5: Ask everyone if they‚Äôre hiring somewhere
strings.work.face.dont_2: Leave CV with staff only (ask manager)
strings.work.face.tip_text: Drop CVs at many places even if it seems unlikely they‚Äôll hire you.
strings.regional.section.title: Regional, farm & extension
strings.regional.section.description: 88 days, 6 months, postcodes, paylips and how to make it count.
strings.regional.extension.title: How the extension works
strings.regional.extension.summary: 88 days (2nd year) and 6 months (3rd year), postcodes and hours.
strings.regional.extension.summary_text: To go from 1st to 2nd year: 88 days regional. From 2nd to 3rd year: 6 months regional.
strings.regional.extension.work_header: Work in a regional area for your extension
strings.regional.extension.condition_text: It‚Äôs not just the job type: the postcode must be on the official list.
strings.regional.extension.dont_title: Don‚Äôt leave it to the end
strings.regional.extension.dont_text: If you‚Äôre tight on days/hours you‚Äôll have no buffer. Keep all paylips.
strings.regional.extension.check_button: Check if a postcode is regional
strings.regional.farm.title: Jobs
strings.regional.farm.summary: Harvest vs farm-hand, hourly vs piece rate.
strings.regional.farm.info_banner_text: Most people find jobs on Facebook groups.
strings.regional.farm.jobs_harvest_body:
Usually hourly or piece rate
Hard at first. Easier once you get rhythm.
strings.regional.farm.jobs_farmhand_body:
Often hourly, long days
More stable but physically demanding.
strings.regional.farm.jobs_hospitality_body:
Comfortable job but harder to find.
üìç Must be in an eligible regional postcode.
strings.transport.section.title: Vehicle
strings.transport.section.description: Buying, rego, roadworthy and tips so it doesn‚Äôt let you down.
strings.transport.buy.title: Buying a car
strings.transport.buy.summary: What to check and how to avoid a lemon.
strings.transport.buy.before_text: Most WHVs buy via Facebook Marketplace and local groups.
strings.transport.buy.warning_text: Too cheap often means hidden issues. If it breaks on the road, it‚Äôll cost you more.
strings.transport.rego.title: Rego / registration
strings.transport.rego.summary: Where to check rego and what happens if it expires.
strings.transport.rego.what_text: Vehicle registration to drive; depends on each state.
strings.transport.rego.before_1: Check active rego and expiry date on the official site.
strings.transport.rego.before_2: See which state it‚Äôs registered in (changing state can cost).
strings.transport.rego.before_3: NSW: also check the greenslip (mandatory insurance).
strings.transport.rego.after_1: Transfer rego within deadline: NSW ~14 days, VIC ~14 days, QLD ~14 days.
strings.transport.rego.after_2: Pay transfer fee and stamp duty if applicable.
strings.transport.rego.after_3: If it expires soon, agree who pays the renewal before signing.
strings.transport.rego.norego_text: Driving without rego = big fines and insurance may not cover anything.
strings.transport.roadworthy.title: Roadworthy
strings.transport.roadworthy.summary: Local RWC and differences by state.
strings.transport.roadworthy.what_text: RWC = basic safety inspection done by authorized workshops.
strings.transport.roadworthy.by_state_1: VIC / QLD: mandatory to sell or transfer.
strings.transport.roadworthy.by_state_2: NSW: only if rego is expired or from another state (blueslip).
strings.transport.roadworthy.by_state_3: Others: may require it for expired rego or out-of-state vehicles.
strings.transport.roadworthy.tip_text: Better pay for an inspection before buying than fix later.
strings.transport.tips.title: Tips
strings.transport.tips.before_text: PPSR (VIN), active rego, RWC if needed, VIN matches papers.
strings.transport.tips.maintenance_1: Oil and filters up to date (every 10‚Äì15k km).
strings.transport.tips.maintenance_2: Tyres, brakes and lights before long trips.
strings.transport.tips.maintenance_3: Extra water/coolant and oil if going remote.
strings.transport.tips.emerg_1: Roadside assist (RACV, NRMA, RACQ...) is cheap and useful far away.
strings.transport.tips.emerg_2: Carry good tyres and basic tools.
strings.money.section.title: Wages, taxes & super
strings.money.section.description: Taxes, superannuation and how to understand your net pay.
strings.money.wages.title: Wages
strings.money.wages.essential_text: Indicative wages; vary by city, experience and contract. Pay is usually weekly or fortnightly.
strings.money.wages.key_4: Casual: a bit more $/h but fewer guarantees.
strings.money.wages.tip_text: If you don‚Äôt get a payslip, flag it and ask right away.
strings.money.taxes.title: Taxes
strings.money.taxes.summary: What gets withheld and how to claim super when leaving.
strings.money.taxes.quick_text: Give your TFN from day one: correct withholding and super in your name. Every pay must come with a payslip.
strings.money.taxes.key_1: Payslip: check hours, rate/h, tax withheld and super.
strings.money.taxes.key_2: WHV tax: ~15% first bracket; can change yearly (check ATO).
strings.money.taxes.key_3: Without TFN they withhold much more.
strings.money.taxes.tip_text: If they withheld too much, you can recover it in the tax return.
strings.money.super.title: Super
strings.money.super.summary: Contributions and what to do when you leave.
strings.money.super.essential_text: Super = mandatory pension. Employer pays ~11% extra to your fund (not from your wage). Give them your fund or they‚Äôll open one.
strings.money.super.key_1: Note fund name and member number.
strings.money.super.key_3: New job: give the same fund to avoid scattered balances.
strings.money.super.tip_text: When you leave, request DASP (super) from outside Australia: need TFN, fund details and international account.
strings.money.super.lost_text: Multiple funds? Find them on ATO online with TFN and consolidate.
